DataElement.preferredName: Other Related Hemoglobin Allele Sickle Cell Disease Type Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there was another related sickle cell disease hemoglobin allele.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Other Relationship Hemoglobin Allele Sickle Cell Disease Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process._A blood disorder characterized by the appearance of sickle-shaped red blood cells and anemia._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.:Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A blood disorder characterized by the appearance of sickle-shaped red blood cells and anemia.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A blood disorder characterized by the appearance of sickle-shaped red blood cells and anemia.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
